description: The figure compares the standard randomized smoothing method for Deep Equilibrium Models (DEQs) and the proposed Serialized Randomized Smoothing (SRS) method.  Standard randomized smoothing independently processes each noisy sample, requiring computation for all D layers in the DEQ.  In contrast, SRS leverages the previous sample's computed representation as the initialization for the next sample. This significantly reduces computation time by processing only S layers (S << D) and then utilizes correlation-eliminated certification to estimate a certified robustness radius.

caption: Figure 2: RRD histogram with MDEQ-LARGE with 20 bins.
description: This figure shows the distribution of Relative Radius Difference (RRD) for the MDEQ-LARGE model. RRD measures how close the certified radius of the proposed Serialized Randomized Smoothing (SRS) method is to the actual certified radius obtained with the standard method.  A smaller RRD indicates better consistency between the two methods. The histogram shows the frequency of different RRD values, allowing for analysis of the method's performance at the instance level.
